notes.text:
Keep hollandaise warm but not hot
Fresh eggs poach best
Practice your poaching technique

steps.descr: Make hollandaise: whisk yolks and lemon juice over double boiler

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started on our lovely hollandaise sauce. Whisk those egg yolks and lemon juice over a double boiler until it's nice and thick.

steps.instructions: Make hollandaise: whisk yolks and lemon juice over double boiler

steps.descr: Slowly drizzle in melted butter while whisking

on_enter.say: Now, let's slowly drizzle in that melted butter while whisking. Keep it smooth and creamy!

steps.instructions: Slowly drizzle in melted butter while whisking

steps.descr: Poach eggs in simmering water with vinegar for 3 minutes

on_enter.say: Time to poach those eggs! Add a splash of vinegar to your simmering water and gently poach the eggs for 3 minutes. You'll see them turn beautifully white and fluffy.

steps.instructions: Poach eggs in simmering water with vinegar for 3 minutes

on_enter.say: Let's get those muffins toasted and bacon sizzling until it's nice and crispy. The aroma will be irresistible!

steps.descr: Assemble: muffin, bacon, poached egg, hollandaise

on_enter.say: Now for the fun part - assembling! Start with the muffin, add the crispy bacon, gently place the poached egg, and drizzle over that luscious hollandaise.

steps.instructions: Assemble: muffin, bacon, poached egg, hollandaise

on_enter.say: Finish it off with a sprinkle of fresh chives for that extra pop of colour and flavour. Beautiful!
Time to serve up and enjoy your delicious Eggs Benedict. Well done!

recipe.title: Eggs Benedict
recipe.description: Classic brunch dish with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce
